Michigan Initial Health & Safety Training Module B
Section 1: Child Development

Act Early Program

A federal program, ‘Act Early’ is a great resource for providers and families.

Center for Disease Control National Program

The program is under the Center for Disease Control, which partnered with the US Department of Education and the US Department of Health & Human Services to create this program.

Free Tools for Child Care Providers to Track Milestones & Engage Families

This program offers free tools for child care providers to track development milestones for the children in their care. In addition, it provides suggestions for engaging families.

Resources to Help Families Track Their Child’s Development, Including Apps for Smart Phones

Act Early also provides free resources to help families track their children’s development. These include a mobile app milestone tracker.

Milestones: 2 months to 5 years

It provides information of developmental milestones for children 2 months to 5 years.

Material in English & Spanish

The material is available in both English and Spanish.

Pharmacy label with all information intact

The pharmacy label must be intact on the bottle and it must include the physician's name, child's first and last name, administration instructions and the name and strength of the medicine.

Connect to Birth to 5: Watch Them Thrive Initiative

Act Early is also connected with the ‘Birth to Five: Watch Them Thrive” initiative that encourages healthy development, universal developmental screening for young children and provides support for providers and families.
